title: JRE, JDK, JVM, Java EE, Java SE

cells.data:
* Java EE, Java SE, Java ME are development environments
  * JSE: a standard edition being used to deploy portable application for general use
  * JME: designed for embedded systems (industrial controls to mobile phones)
  * JSE: additional libraries which provides functionality to deploy fault-tolerant, distributed, multi-tier Java software, based on modular components running on an application server
* JVM: an abstract machine, providing runtime nevironment in which java byte code can be executed
  * load code, verifies code, execute code, provide run time environment
* JRE: Java Runtime Environment, contains JVM, class libraries and other supporting files, no compiler or debugger tools
  * **JRE = JVM + Java Package Classes + runtime libraries**
  * Jre is the box and JVM is the content of the box
* JDK: Java Development Kit, a software development environment used for developing Java applications and aplets
  * includes JRE, a loader (Java), a compiler (javac), an archiver (jar), a documentation generator (javadoc) and other tools
